snippet: An increase in the sales tax took a heavy toll on household spending, stoking fears that any rebound may be too modest to sustain a solid recovery.
abstract: Japan's April-June quarter represents biggest economic contraction since March 2011 earthquake as increase in sales tax took heavy toll on household spending; economy shrank an annualized 6.8 percent in second quarter.
lead_paragraph: An increase in the sales tax took a heavy toll on household spending, stoking fears that any rebound may be too modest to sustain a solid recovery.

headline.main: Contraction in Japan Is Largest Since 2011
